page.title: 11WARNEFORD HOSPITAL.
page.content: The Warneford Hospital was built in 1832. It was named after Dr. Samuel Warneford, the main benefactor. It serves a community of 250,000 people from Stratford to Solihull. There are nine wards with 204 beds; four operating theatres, two always in use, one day-theatre and one in the maternity block. The hospital also treats 3 900 outpatients and has a big ophthalmic department. About 1,800 births occur each year at the hospital which employs about 350 staff including doctors, nurses, secretaries, clerks, cooks, cleaners, electricians, porters and storemen. Some jobs were lost recently through privatisation. Rumours exist that the hospital might close and become a home for old people. Patients said the hospital had a kind and friendly atmosphere.
